plugins.name: Scribe - Dynamic data in seconds
plugins.description:
Meet Scribe – The Mail Merge for Figma for crafting data-driven graphics.


Scribe can help you automate and mass generate frames with real dynamic data!


===

Let me walk you through an example. You are Albus Dumbledore and you need to generate acceptance letters for the new batch at Hogwarts. The new batch has 40 students and Professor McGonagall has already handed off the letter to you on Figma.


Now, you are definitely not going to change the name and export the letter 40 times. That's too brutal. That's too naïve.

Let Scribe cast its magic.

===


And with this new and upgraded version – Scribe is more powerful than ever.


Here's what Scribe can do:

💿 Import data from a CSV or a Google Sheet

🎞 Generate from multiple frames in one go

🔒 No more publicly published Google Sheets. Scribe Bot can now be added to your Sheet and Drive as a collaborator

💬 Replace the content of Text Layers

🗯 Partially replace the content of Text Layers

📸 Replace fill of Frame Layer with images

⚡️ Transform layers with Customisations

☁️ Special integration with Google Drive to make managing images painless

📦 Customise your exports

🏎 Under the hood, Scribe is rewritten from scratch with performance at the centre stage. On my machine (MacBook Pro 2020, M1), It generated 1000 frames with Text Layers in about 724 seconds. That's 0.72 seconds per frame. That's ffaasstt!


How to use:

✏️ Name the layers

The layer names of text layers must begin with a # followed by the field name of the Data Source column that they'd be substituted by.

For example: For a Data Source containing names of people in the column name , the name of the text layer in Figma would be #name. Naming is case-sensitive.

There are plenty more customisations available in the documentation.


🏃‍♀️ Run Scribe

Select your frame and run Scribe.


📀 Import data

You can import the data from a CSV file or a Google Sheet.


⚙️ Configure and scribe

Tweak some settings to make the setup really personal. Finally, scribe and have your graphics handcrafted and exported to you in mere seconds.


Why Scribe?

There's so much Scribe can do.

- Generate certificates for the awesome attendees of your conference

- Perform a batch generation of coupons

- Create personalised gratitude-full letters for all your small-business supporters


Give Scribe a try if you want to:

- Create beautiful data-driven graphics in a fraction of the time it takes to do by hand

- Automate the process of creating a bunch of graphics with real data


There's a Kitchen Sink available here to showcase the power of Scribe: 

👾 https://youtu.be/EOWnPWuPNPI


And here's the entire documentation:

📝 https://docs.scribe.ishanchhabra.com
plugins.tagline: The Mail Merge for Figma for crafting data-driven graphics.

plugins.name: AffinityGPT
plugins.description:
AffinityGPT is an AI-driven plugin designed to streamline your affinity diagramming process powered by ChatGPT. Simplify, categorize, and generate with intelligence and efficiency.


Features

  1. Affinity Diagramming: Simply drag all of your sticky notes, type a design question, and hit the 'Analyze It' button. AffinityGPT takes over from there, automatically categorizing your sticky notes up to two hierarchical levels for a cleaner, more organized view.
  2. Create Sample Sticky Notes: Whether you're just starting out or wish to run a test, create sample sticky notes in an instant with just one click. Perfect for visualizing, experimenting, or kickstarting your design brainstorming.


Feedback & Bugs

Your feedback is invaluable to us! If you come across any issues or have suggestions to enhance AffinityGPT, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at hyunbangux@gmail.com.
plugins.tagline: Automate Affinity Diagramming using AI

plugins.name: Easy Proto
plugins.description:
Presenting Pro Proto, redefining better prototyping in Figma. Designed to supercharge your design workflow.


Maximize Your A/B Prototyping

Want to experiment with diverse layouts or user flows? Empower your testing and presentations with our dual-prototyping feature, allowing you to run two concurrent prototypes side-by-side, and they can be from different design files!


No more tab jumping

Enjoy the convenience of a floating prototype window layered over your editor. It allows you to swiftly test, iterate, and refine your designs without the disruption of swapping between separate Figma tabs or files.


Resizable and Collapsable

Need more room for your editor? Freely resize the window or instantly collapse the window. Done with your edits? Expand your window back with a single button click.


Auto-Reopen Functionality

Swiftly resume your prototyping sessions without missing a beat. Our Auto-Reopen feature ensures your prototypes from your last session are ready to be further refined or presented instantly.


The Power of Convenience

With Easy Proto, simply select a frame in your design file or open prototype flows from the active design file. The feature will automatically initiate the prototypes.


Ready to Take Your Prototyping to the Next Level?


Easy Proto is set to redefine your prototyping experience in Figma. Go Pro, and unlock the future of efficient and intuitive prototyping today!




Support me

Additionally, If you find the Easy Proto plugin valuable and want to support its development, please consider becoming a subscriber or supporter on Ko-fi! Your support helps me continue to create and maintain useful tools for you and the figma design community. Visit my Ko-fi page at https://ko-fi.com/joshiee to learn more and show your support.
plugins.tagline: The better multi-screen prototyping experience

plugins.name: Clean handoff
plugins.description:
Optimize your handoff design workflow with version controlling and structured Figma project using the “Clean handoff” free Figma plugin. 


Coordinating between the Design and Development departments while working simultaneously on Figma projects can be a hassle, for the most part, it can take a while for both teams to find an organized path to achieving the ultimate goal from my own experience. 

So how about a new Figma plugin to ameliorate the whole Design/Implementation process?


The process goes as follows; Designers design mockups (high fidelity) on Figma and then hand them to the Frontend team for implementation. Here’s the pain in this process; edits can still occur from the Design team. Not often, but it can happen. It could be simply by mistake or intentional. Either way, changes have been made while the Developers are working on the same Figma page and specifically on the same Frame. 


Following this encounter, my goal was to generate a sustainable and efficient solution for all who might be facing this type of problem on Figma.


I then developed a new Figma Plugin that would help teams have:


  1. Better structures for Figma projects
  2. Version control system for a better trackability
  3. Improved workflow between Developers and Designers


Easy to use:

[First feature] Generate a structured Figma project by clicking the first option. 

[Second feature] Open the handoff design modal and follow the steps:

  • Select any frames you want for handoff designs (Default: all frames selected).
  • Select “Create new page” or handoff frames to an existing page.
  • Add a handoff design version number (Required for handoff to a new page) with the option of locking selected frames (toggle).
  • Add related Link e.g. asana task, Jira ticket, or Github PR link ... (Optional)
  • Add a short description about changes done (Optional)
  • Hit the “Handoff designs” button, and the plugin will take it from there 🎉✨ .


Start improving your workflow today.


Contributing to the community is such an incredible feeling ♥️, I am happy to receive your feedback to improve this plugin. So Figmers, feel free to share your thoughts.

accepted.name: Samy Hammami
accepted.description: I'm Samy, the soul behind the design!

plugins.name: Sweeper - design linter
plugins.description:
Fix errors in your designs!

Sweeper v2 open beta is out.


Make sure your design are crystal clear, with no half pixels, no disconnected styles, and ready for handoff!


While the plugin is running, it will monitor errors you specified and gives you an easy way to fix them with a press of a button.


Sweeper offers linting off:


  • Making layers pixel perfect (no half pixels)
  • No hidden layers
  • Layer name linting
  • Require text, fill, stroke and effect styles
  • No groups (at all) or no 1 layer groups
  • And more coming soon!


If you would like to report an issue, create a GitHub ticket or reach out @rojcyk.

accepted.name: Denis Rojčyk
accepted.description: I help companies design their digital products so that they can grow their business.

plugins.name: StoryCraft - Design to User Story Converter
plugins.description:
Our plugin converts Figma designs into comprehensive user stories. Streamline your designers' transition to the engineering team with a click.


Instructions

  1. Choose your desired design in Figma.
  2. Use the 'Generate User Story' option in our plugin.
  3. Finally, your design is converted into a user story, which can be copied and paste to your favourite project management tool.


The plugin utilizes GPT-4 Vision, which is currently in the beta version. Sometimes it refuses to generate user stories, but if you try it a second time, it will work.
plugins.tagline: Transforming Figma Designs into Detailed User Stories Instantly.

plugins.name: Figma Variables
plugins.description:
Hi Figmate! This plugin aims to let you define your variables to keep design tokens consistent in your file across time.


It complements the existing design variables that Figma manages already well. This is why you will find every property but colors, text styles, effects, and strokes.


I use it for both local variables like table columns width and global variables like the spacing between my cards.


I hope this plugin will help you in your daily job!

plugins.name: Random colour assigner
plugins.description:
Random colour assigner helps you apply colours from your colour style folders to selected elements with ease. With options for random and sequential colour assignment, you can quickly bring consistency to your designs while saving time.


Features:

  • Apply colours from a selected colour style folder
  • Assign colours randomly or sequentially
  • Apply colours to fills or strokes
  • The plugin will try not to use the same colour twice but will keep looping through the colours if there are more nodes selected than the available colours.
  • Simple and intuitive user interface


Limitations:

  • The plugin works with solid colour styles only
  • Only nodes that support fills can have colour styles applied


How to use:

  1. Select the elements you want to apply colour styles to
  2. Choose a colour style folder from the dropdown menu
  3. Select the "Sequential Colours" checkbox for sequential assignment or leave it unchecked for random assignment
  4. Click the "Assign" button to apply the colours


Random Colour Assigner makes it easy to apply consistent colour styles to your designs in a matter of seconds. Enhance your workflow and give it a try today!
plugins.tagline: Randomly apply color styles from a selected folder to selected elements

plugins.name: Amplitude Event Planner
plugins.description:
Quickly create event labels on top of your designs to visually communicate what user actions or events to track. You can easily edit labels, view/hide labels, and export all events as a CSV file.


How to create a label:

  1. Select the frame or layer you want the event label to outline
  2. Select “Create Event Label” under the Amplitude Event Planner plugin
  3. Describe your event with:
  4. - Event Trigger: when the event should be triggered
  5. - Name: the name of your event (we recommend a verb + noun format)
  6. - Description: descriptive details on when the event is triggered
  7. - Note for Developer: any notes to communicate to the developer, eg. what properties you want to track with the event


We hope this plugin helps designers bring analytics into their design process and streamlines your analytics planning.


If you have any questions or feedback, please file an issue on Github or let us know at platform@amplitude.com.


Additional Resources:

  • Source Code
  • Data Taxonomy Playbook
  • Developers Center
  • Govern & Taxonomy Article

plugins.name: Sync Design Tokens
plugins.description:
Automatically create and update Figma Styles from a design tokens url.


Import Style Dictionary (json) design tokens into your Figma so you don't have to manually create or update styles.


How it works

  • Enter the URL for your json design tokens file
  • Choose the variable formatting style
  • Click 'Import Tokens' button


What's supported?

Creates & updates color design tokens from a URL. In the future, I hope to expand support to other token types like font, grids, spacing, etc.

plugins.name: Color shades sync
plugins.description:
Useful action.

Automatic update child shades when the parent color changes in styles.


Features.

You can create child shades using lightening, darkening, and opacity scales. 


The tool.

Through specifying a command in the color description field.

"Name the parent color with one word [space] command=value"

Example: red opacity=80


Commands:

opacity

darkness

lightness


To fine-tune the child shade on the darkness and lightness scales, you need to switch the color to HSL mode and move to the L field. 

Move up from the current state - movement on the lightness scale.  

Move down from the current state - movement on the darkness scale.  


The inspiration for creating this plugin was the "color sync" plugin

accepted.name: Dmitry Chashchinov
accepted.description: UX/UI Designer & Developer

plugins.name: Perceptual Color
plugins.description:
The Perceptual Color plugin allows you to inspect and manipulate color gradients and solid colors using the OKLCH color space, which is a perceptual color space that is supported on the web (CSS Color Module Level 4).


Instructions

  1. Run the plugin
  2. Select one or more layers with Gradient fills.
  3. Inspect and modify the gradients in OKLCH color space


NOTE: Figma does not yet support OKLCH color and so the color blending (or interpolation) between colors in Figma is done in RGB color space. Therefore, Figma will not reflect the gradient you will see in the plugin or on the web. I may incorporate a workaround to add a special fill to the node that will help visualize the way OKLCH blends colors while keeping the node's original fill intact.

accepted.name: Jeremy Knudsen
accepted.description: Visual Systems Designer at Microsoft

plugins.tagline: Manipulate color in a perceptual color space for more accessible and delightful customer experiences

plugins.name: Auto sort layers
plugins.description:
I have created a small plugin , which can automatically arrange layer order in canvas based on their relative position from top-left to bottom-right according to your frame.


Example:

You have created a series of portfolios and arranged them from top-left to bottom-right. By running this plugin, the layer order will be automatically sorted. After that, you can perform batch renaming, such as "Portfolio01", "Portfolio02", etc. The exported results will be well-organized.


Usage:

  1. Arrange the positions of the frames (from top left to bottom right, or in a row or column).
  2. Select them.
  3. Run the plugin.
  4. The sorting will be done automatically.🎉


If it helps you, you can buy me a cup of tea 🍵


---------------------------------------------


我制作了一个小插件，他可以使用根据你的 Frame 在画布中的相对位置，从左上到右下，自动排列图层顺序。


例子：

做了一系列作品集，将他们按照左上到右下摆好，运行此插件将自动整理好图层顺序，如此之后进行批量重命名，就像 作品集01、作品集02...导出的结果将井然有序。


用法：

  1. 摆好 Frame位置（左上到右下，或一行，一列，都行）
  2. 选中他们
  3. 运行插件
  4. 排序将自动完成🎉



如果你想支持我，你可以给我 整杯龙井🍵，让我长长见识

plugins.name: Print Style Guide
plugins.description:
Generate a comprehensive style guide from local styles and variables


✨ Supports variables, color styles, text styles, effects, and grids

✨ Run the plugin from anywhere in your file to print a style guide on a designated page

✨ Re-run the plugin at any time to update the documentation as your file evolves

✨ Update the components to your preference


Options

Print additional rgba and hsl color information

Print additional variable properties

Generate a navigation menu for each collection/group

Hyperlink bound variables across the page


Upgrade

You will be asked to buy a license after 10 plugin opens. Upgrading includes unlimited usage and all future updates. Thank you for your support.


Note: This plugin was previously a subscription, but I've recently changed it to a one-time upgrade. If you bought the plugin while it was a subscription and would like to continue using it, you can email me at jaclyntan02@gmail.com for a refund through Stripe/Paypal. Thank you for your support 💕

plugins.name: Color Luminance
plugins.description:
Display the relative luminance (how bright color appear to our eyes) of the selected colors.


Colors can be adjusted to match a desired luminance levels.


When only two colors are selected, their contrast ratio is also displayed.


The plugin is especially helpful when creating or working with palettes that organizes colors in steps based on their relative luminance.


Organizing palettes this way is a robust approach that in addition makes it easier predicting contrast ratio to comply with e.g. WCAG 2.1,

as colors of a certain luminance value always has the same contrast ratio to other colors another luminance value.

plugins.name: Webhook Configurator
plugins.description:
!!!IMPORTANT!!!

It seems like Figma decided to remove access to webhooks from the professional plan and require an origanization plan now.


Since i'm not willing to pay 45 €/month to develop this plugin, i will no longer be working on this (and might remove it in the future).


You can, of course, check the developer documentation and run your own plugin.

------------------------------------------------------------------


Create & manage your teams' webhooks.


E.g. have file updates notify you in Slack by triggering your workflows or send updates to custom endpoints.



You can...

  • create webhooks for teams
  • view a list of webhooks for your teams
  • remove webhooks
  • view past (restricted to one week) calls made to the webhook from Figma.


Requirements

  • To manage a team's webhooks you need to be at least an administrator for that team & that team needs to be on the necessary paid plan (check the pricing page)
  • You need to have/create a "Personal Access Token" (within Figma go to your avatar -> settings)
  • The team ID of the team for which to manage webhooks

plugins.name: Nudge - Editable Figma designs from mobbin for top apps
plugins.description:
Introducing Nudge: Your New Design Superpower ✨

Hey designers! Ever wish you could grab those stunning UI screens you find online and make them instantly editable?

With Nudge, now you can. We’ve taken the hassle out of design inspiration and turned it into a tool you can actually work with. Think editable, customizable, and ready to roll – straight into your Figma projects.


Why us?

Here’s what you’ll love:

* Editable Screens: Skip the grunt work. Take beautifully crafted UI screens and tweak them to match your creative vision.

* Completely Free: No paywalls, no subscriptions – just pure design goodness, forever.

* For Learning & Growing: Whether you're exploring, experimenting, or prototyping, this tool is perfect for honing your skills.

* Save Time, Big Time: Forget starting from scratch. Get straight to the fun part – designing.

* Non-Commercial Use: A tool built by designers, for designers. Keep it personal, keep it creative.


Perfect for Everyone

* Just getting started? Use editable screens to learn how the pros do it.

* Pro designer? Speed up your process without compromising your creativity.


Here’s How It Works:

1. Install the plugin on Figma (it’s super easy).

2. Browse through a library of editable UI screens.

3. Make it yours – tweak, customize, and innovate!


Why You’ll Love It

* Save hours recreating screens from scratch.

* Explore endless design possibilities.

* Focus on creating, not searching.


Join our community from here : Nudge

We'd love to hear your thoughts! For any feedback or if you spot bugs, reach out to us at ask@getcreatr.com


Let’s turn great ideas into even greater designs


Important Note 📝

Nudge is free and meant for educational and personal use only. It’s not affiliated with any third-party platform. Remember to customize the screens and play nice with copyright rules.
plugins.tagline: Your favorite UI screens with fully editable designs ! Access 1000's of screens in just few clicks

plugins.name: Figma to DeckDeckGo
plugins.description:
A free and open source plugin to export Figma frames to DeckDeckGo slides.


How does it work?


  • Use the plugin to export your frames
  • Download the resulting file
  • Go to the DeckDeckGo editor
  • Open the data to create a new presentation


About:


DeckDeckGo is a web open source editor for presentations.


  • Interact with your audience with live polls
  • Interact with your presentations with a remote control
  • Create, present and share your slides as Progressive Web Apps
  • Use predefined rich and responsive templates
  • Search Unsplash and Tenor GIFs
  • Integrate easily Youtube video
  • Showcase your best developer code snippets
  • Interact with your presentations with a remote control
  • Present and work offline
  • Push the source code of your online slides to GitHub


To reach us on Slack, Email or Twitter.


Report any issues or bugs in the plugin repo on GitHub.


Your support is very much appreciated!

plugins.name: SwitchCase.xyz | UPPERCASE, lowercase, Title Case, slug-text, and other case converter.
plugins.description:
The SwitchCase.xyz Figma Plugin brings the powerful and versatile text transformation capabilities of SwitchCase.xyz directly into Figma and FigJam.


This plugin allows you to quickly and easily switch the case of your text to various formats, helping you stay efficient.


How To Use:

  • Once installed, either select a text box, or a frame.
  • Hit Ctrl + / on Windows, or Cmd + / on MAC.
  • Search for "SwitchCase.xyz" or the specific type of conversion you need (Eg: UPPERCASE), and select it.
  • That's it!


Works Within

  • ✅ Fully compatible with both Figma and FigJam.
  • ⚠ If you select a Frame/Layer, the extension would try to recursively change the name of every child frame and element.
  • 🔀 All changes made by the plugin should go away with a simple 'Undo'. Just hit Hit Ctrl + Z on Windows, or Cmd + Z on MAC.


Conversion Options:

The plugin offers a variety of text conversion options, including:

  • UPPER CASE: Convert text to all uppercase letters.
  • lower case: Convert text to all lowercase letters.
  • Capital Case: Capitalize the first letter of each word.
  • Sentence case: Capitalize the first letter of each sentence. Expects each sentence to be separated by '. ' (full stop + space)
  • AlTeRnAtE CaSe: Convert text to alternating uppercase and lowercase.
  • Slugify Text: Convert text to a slug ("- separated).
  • Base64 Encode/Decode: Convert text to Base64 encoded/decoded string.
  • ...and many more options you can find on SwitchCase.xyz!


Spot a bug? Let me know!
plugins.tagline: Official SwitchCase.xyz extension for Figma. Also works on Figjam.

plugins.name: Base64
plugins.description:
Encode selected nodes into Base64 and get code snippets in Figma Dev mode for HTML, CSS, React.js and React Native, SVG, JSON, Data URI.

Compatible with Figma for VS Code extension.


Base64 plugin encodes the nodes to the Data URI scheme and generates the code based on the export settings. In the Figma export settings, you can apply several settings at once, for example, add the required number of resources of different formats (such as PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF), specify the scaling factor and suffix, and the plugin will automatically generate and update the code for these settings with the appropriate format and MIME type.


In the plugin settings, you can control which code snippets will be displayed in the Inspect panel, as well as show/hide comments in the code. To do this, click the Inspect settings icon > Settings in the Code section of the Inspect panel.


The Base64 plugin is also available for Penpot. You can install it from the Penpot Hub.


Donation:

You can support the development and maintenance of this plugin by donating via destream.


Creator:

Yury Zeliankouski


My other projects:

  1. Glyphs plugin;
  2. Change Font plugin;
  3. Translation Suggestions plugin;
  4. Code Block to File plugin;
  5. Translate widget;
  6. How many Sticky Notes? widget.

plugins.name: Views
plugins.description:
Bookmark the important parts of your file

Views lets you organize and present your work.


"A must-have plugin for navigating large files and showing work to others." @dnlbtlr


Here is a great step-by-step by @chris_lueders_


How to create views

  1. Position and zoom any part of your file
  2. Hit + to save view


How to view your err... views:

  1. Hit ↱ beside the view name
  2. Double-click view
  3. Hit ▶︎ to present
  4. Hide/show any view from presentation by clicking on 🔵


Main features:

  1. Save views anywhere in your file so you can go back to them with one click (or 2 if you prefer). It remembers position and zoom level
  2. Organize views and name them whatever you'd like (you can use 💩 too
  3. Group views anyway you want, like a group for each team member (I hope you are not more than 3 :-D), category or version...
  4. Present views with compact controls and keyboard navigation (and now with custom background color)
  5. Hide from presentation any views you want to have saved but not included when presenting
  6. Smooth transitions navigating between views to impress you, your friends, your cat and your clients
  7. Use it without the UI using Quick Actions you can jump from view to view just by using shortcuts (like ⌥ ⌘ P)
plugins.tagline: Bookmark the important parts of your file

plugins.name: @sposhe/poisson
plugins.description:
Poisson

Generates a random distribution of one or more elements a minimum distance apart. Optionally randomizes rotation.


How to Use

  1. Create a frame
  2. Add one or more elements to the frame (these can be shapes, component instances, or other frames)
  3. Select the frame
  4. Run the plugin
  5. Set a minimum distance threshold (and optionally set if rotation should be randomized)
  6. Press the "Create" button


How it Works

The plugin creates a new frame beside the source frame, and draws copies of the source element(s) using the poisson-disc distribution algorithm until the frame is filled. If more than one source element is used, the source element for each node is chosen randomly.


Under the Hood

The plugin uses Beau Gunderson's poisson-disk-sampler javascript package, which is based on Mike Bostock's implementation of Jason Davies' implementation of Bridson's algorithm. View Mike Bostock's great explanation of how poisson-disc sampling works.
plugins.tagline: Generates a random distribution of one or more elements a minimum distance apart.

plugins.name: Figma Token Manager - Reorder Variable Modes
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to drag and drop reorder your variable modes in your collections. Select a collection to fetch all the variables it contains. After your tokens loaded, you can reorder your collection modes by drag and drop. Once your are satisfied with the result, hit "Save changes" and your modes' order will get updated.


Features

  • Load tokens from your Figma file
  • Select from your collections
  • Reorder variable modes in selected collection


This plugin comes with 5 free trials, after which you'll be prompted to purchase a license key for a one-time payment to enjoy the plugin without limits.
plugins.tagline: Reorder your Figma variable modes using drag and drop.

plugins.name: DataPocket
plugins.description:
Integrate your data feeds and eCommerce products directly into Figma


Elevating design systems with DataPocket and Figma integration

DataPocket seamlessly integrates with Figma, enabling designers to access real-time data within their design environment. This integration streamlines workflows, ensures consistency, and enhances collaboration by incorporating live data directly into design systems.

Seamless integration into any design system

Consistent and centralized data access across design projects

Real-time updates and synchronization of data within design systems


Increased efficiency in prototyping and testing with accurate, real data

Enhanced scalability and collaboration to accommodate growing design requirements

Improved decision-making through data-driven design insights


More about the Plugin:


Real Time data access 

Access real-time data from sources like WooCommerce, Shopify, and more, directly within Figma. Streamline collaboration, boost productivity, and unlock new creative possibilities with DataPocket.


DataPocket for Figma Teams

Work cross functionally with different teams/businesses without having to worry about using the correct/relevant product data. DataPocket continuously updates product data from the source so everyone has access to the most up to date data. Gone are the days of having to redo a mock up or piece of content because the wrong information was used.


Data Sources always up-to-date

DataPocket formats all Product data allowing it to be used for drag and drop on design platforms like Figma and Canva allowing teams to easily drag and drop any modifications to the product and update their designs/mockups in seconds.
plugins.tagline: Integrate your data feeds and eCommerce products directly into Figma

plugins.name: Color Tokens
plugins.description:
Instructions:


  1. Copy the ColorToken component
  2. Apply your a color variable to the mainColor layer
  3. Run the plugin on a page with ColorToken instances


The variable name, HEX, RGBA, and aliases will be automatically populate for all ColorToken variants on the page. Additionally, you can turn on the contrast variable and apply any color, rerun the plugin and it will populate the contrast-ratio rating.


*Note: You can change component name but please do not rename layers.
plugins.tagline: Document all your color variables in one place, exactly how you want them
